big_picture_notes: Galatians is a forensic rhetorical defense of Paul’s apostleship and the gospel of justification by faith against Judaizers. Structure: Personal Defense (chs. 1–2) → Theological Proof (chs. 3–4) → Practical Exhortation (chs. 5–6). Literary glue: Law vs Promise, Flesh vs Spirit, Abraham motif, and the striking omission of a thanksgiving (1:6) signaling urgency. Devices include sustained allegory (4:21–31), rapid rhetorical questions (3:1–5), and analogies (will/covenant 3:15; guardian/son 4:1–7).

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) emphatic apostolic claim ‘not from men…’ sets authority theme; end (2:21) climactic summary that law‑righteousness nullifies grace, closing the personal/apologetic narrative. Glue: ‘man/men’ vs divine revelation, apostle/commission language, temporal markers (‘then’).

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Atypical salutation flows straight to ‘I am astonished’; double anathema seals rebuke; v.10 pivots to motive. Devices: curse repetition, rhetorical question.
‘I would have you know…’ introduces defense; ends with non‑consultation and non‑Jerusalem route. Devices: contrast (flesh/blood vs revelation), brisk narrative.
Three years → fourteen years timeline; Titus case; right hand of fellowship; remember the poor. Devices: chronology markers, dialogue with ‘pillars’.
Public rebuke over hypocrisy; justification by faith stated. Devices: rhetorical questions, Jew/Gentile contrast, programmatic 2:16.

scenes.scene_name: Death to Law, Life in Christ
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: ‘Crucified with Christ’; living by faith; grace not nullified. Devices: paradox of substitution, climactic maxim.

stories.story_title: The Theological Proof of Justification by Faith
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (3:1) vocative invective turns to Scripture‑anchored proof; end (4:31) resolves the allegory: children of the free. Glue: Spirit vs flesh, Abraham motif, promise vs law vocabulary recurring across proofs and analogies.

scenes.scene_name: Spirit Received by Faith, Not Law
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: ‘O foolish Galatians’ and rapid questions conclude with God supplying Spirit by faith. Devices: interrogative barrage, experiential proof.
‘Just as’ introduces Gen 15:6; blessing extends to those of faith. Devices: proof by Scripture, inclusio of blessing.

scenes.scene_name: Curse of Law and Christ’s Redemption
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: OT citations frame curse→redemption; blessing to Gentiles. Devices: antithesis, substitution (‘became a curse’).
Human covenant analogy; inheritance by promise; ‘seed’ singular to Christ. Devices: legal analogy, lexical focus.
Temporary, mediated law; Scripture imprisoned all for the promise by faith. Devices: rhetorical question, imprisonment metaphor.

scenes.scene_name: Guardian to Christ; Heirs by Faith
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Before faith… paidagogos; baptismal union; one in Christ; heirs. Devices: guardian analogy, triadic equality, heir conclusion.
Heir under guardians→redemption→adoption; ‘Abba’ cry. Devices: heir analogy, Spirit of Son, status summary.
Former ignorance→observance of elements; Paul fears labor in vain. Devices: pathos appeal, elemental spirits critique.
Become as I am; you received me; labor in birth again. Devices: autobiographical appeal, maternal metaphor, perplexity close.
‘Do you not listen to the law?’; slave/free, below/above Jerusalem; Isa 54:1; children of the free. Devices: extended allegory, contrast pairs, scriptural citation.

stories.story_title: Freedom and Ethical Life in the Spirit
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (5:1) climactic imperative to stand firm pivots from doctrine to duty; end (6:10) universal good‑doing seals the paraenesis before the autograph close. Glue: flesh vs Spirit antithesis, love fulfilling law, sowing/reaping motivation.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Do not submit to yoke; circumcision nullifies Christ; faith working through love. Devices: antithesis, conditional warnings, climactic maxim.
Running metaphor; little leaven; severe wish against troublers. Devices: athletic imagery, proverb, polemical hyperbole.
Through love serve one another; law fulfilled in neighbor love; beware mutual destruction. Devices: love maxim, antithetical warning.
Imperative principle; Spirit vs flesh conflict; not under law. Devices: condensed antithesis, jurisdiction move.
Catalog of vices ends with inheritance warning. Devices: vice list, legal exclusion formula.
Singular fruit with nine traits; keep in step; avoid conceit/provocation/envy. Devices: virtue list, social application close.
Gentle restoration; bear one another’s burdens yet each bears his load. Devices: paradox of burden/load, self‑testing admonition.
Share with teachers; reap what you sow; do good to all, especially the household of faith. Devices: agricultural metaphor, perseverance encouragement.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (6:11) autograph marker introduces the closing; end (6:18) benediction concludes the letter. Glue: cross vs flesh boasting, new creation as true mark, and Paul’s stigmata as authority seal.

scenes.scene_name: Boast of the Cross and Benediction
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Large‑letters autograph; cross‑boast over circumcision; new creation rule; grace benediction. Devices: contrast summary, personal marks (stigmata), epistolary close.
